main event: A sighting of a half-moon shaped object observed from Indian Springs, Nevada on February 6, 1961, using ground-radar and visual observation.
interesting points: The object was described as half-moon shaped and measured 6-8 feet,The object had an azimuth of 144-70 and did not disappear or move erratically, The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes, The observer was a weather forecaster experienced with balloon launches, The conclusion from the report suggested it was probably a weather balloon or an aircraft, but data was insufficient for definite evaluation.
witness description: A weather forecaster at Nellis AFB who works with balloons daily.
